trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.RowCommand"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.RowCommand> event is raised when a button within the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control is clicked.
This allows you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine whenever this event occurs.

> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control also raises other specialized events when certain buttons are clicked (buttons with the `CommandName` property set to "Delete", "Update", and "Page" for example).

When using one of these buttons, you should consider handling one of the specialized events provided by the control (such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.RowDeleted> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.RowDeleting>).
A GridViewCommandEventArgs object is passed to the event-handling method, which allows you to determine the command name and command argument of the button clicked.

To determine the command name and command argument, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A> properties, respectively.
You can also access the button control that raised the event by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> property.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
For a list of initial property values for an instance of GridViewCommandEventArgs, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewCommandEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewCommandEventArgs"></xref> class using the specified source of the command and event arguments.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewCommandEventArgs> class.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewCommandEventArgs>.

|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A>|The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> object contained in the `originalArgs` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A>|The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> object contained in the `originalArgs` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A>|The object contained in the `commandSource` parameter.| > [!NOTE] > This constructor is used primarily by control developers when raising events.
The source of the command.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs"></xref> object that contains event data.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewCommandEventArgs"></xref> class using the specified row, source of the command, and event arguments.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewCommandEventArgs> class.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewCommandEventArgs>.

|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A>|The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> object contained in the `originalArgs` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A>|The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> object contained in the `originalArgs` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A>|The object contained in the `commandSource` parameter.| > [!NOTE] > This constructor is used primarily by control developers when raising events.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object that represents the row containing the button.
The source of the command.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs"></xref> object that contains event data.
Gets the source of the command.
Use the CommandSource property to access the properties of the object that represents the source of the command.

In the case of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewCommandEventArgs> object, the source of the command is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control that contains the button clicked by the user.
A instance of the <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> class that represents the source of the command.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control has handled the event.
Set this property to `true` in the event handler to specify that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control should not handle the event because you are handling it in your code.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if data-bound event code was skipped or has finished; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
